column1: Thanks very much to everyone who made this section possible by sending in their news and photographs to the Alumni Office. All information is correct at the time of going to print, and submissions have been edited for content and length. Would you like to contact someone who hasn't sent in an update? Just send your correspondence in a sealed and stamped envelope with the name of the person for whom it is intended on the front to the Alumni Office â we'll be happy to forward it on your behalf!

column1: CROOKSTON, Nicola [BA Hons Tourism] spent the summer working as a team leader for a holiday company in Italy running the children's clubs. Nicola returned to Dundee last August to complete her PGDE in Primary Education.

DAYAL, Saurabh [MSc Biotechnology] keeps busy with his work as a cancer researcher at Ninewells Hospital. Saurabh says his association with Abertay has been very productive and he is thankful to the Abertay faculty for their support and dedication. Saurabh writes that he is looking forward to participating in future events and reunions to refresh the memories of his wonderful days at uni, and sends his best wishes to everyone at Abertay.

McCORMICK, Brian [BSc Mechatronics] was approached by Clyde Marine Training in Glasgow about opportunities at sea while doing his degree. After a successful interview he was assigned a sponsoring company and began a course in marine engineering operations at the Glasgow College of Nautical Studies. The company sponsoring Brian ships bananas from the Caribbean, so during the sea-going phase of training, he was placed aboard one of their carrier vessels to that region. After completing his training, Brian was approached by Petrofac Facilities Management in Aberdeen and successfully completed an interview for that position.

PSOMAS, Julien [BA Hons Marketing with Spanish] has elected to continue with his studies, and recently began an MBA in Hospitality Management at Ecole International de Savignac in France. He is looking forward to working after completing his studies.
SCHMERBAUCH, Jana [BA Marketing] continued with her studies in Germany. Jana is relieved to have completed her examinations last October.

SIDDIQUI, Adeel [MSc Industrial Environmental Management] is employed with the Pakistan office of the non-profit organisation World Wide Fund, an organisation renowned for its conservation work around the world. Adeel is currently involved in a fresh water programme and has been developing different projects on the 'brown issue' (problems relations to urban pollution) in Pakistan. He recently completed an extensive four-year project with Pakistan's city district government, Karachi Pakistan for Air Quality Management, funded by corporate members of WWF.

column1: PACK, Anne [BA Hons Information Management] has joined the growing ranks of Munro baggers. Having turned 50 last year, Anne made a New Year's resolution to climb a Munro some time in 2006. Previously, she had enjoyed lower grade hills such as the Sidlaws, but now she felt she was ready for something bigger, and on a cold day in January 2006, Anne climbed her first Munro (Mayar), accompanied by her husband Alan. She says she was hooked from day one, and she and her husband bought maps, books, and all manner of gear and began keeping a journal with notes and photographs. To date Anne has bagged 30 Munros, and it is her intention to bag them all, in spite of the harrowing experience she had on her third outing, during a white-out in freezing conditions where the water bottles froze and the wind got up, causing Anne and her husband to walk off the wrong side of the hill. Says Anne, "It was frightening at the time but we have a laugh about it now, and I've even written a funny song about it called 'Take a Hike' ".

column1: BHATTACHARYA, Kashyap [BA Hons Economics] sends a big hello to all his friends and alumni. Kash and fiancÃ©e Robin Bela [MBA 2005] were married on 17th December in Delhi, India in a ceremony attended by former Abertay classmates Euan Johnstone [PGDip Entrepreneurship 2004], Asela Perera [PGDip Entrepreneurship2004], and Chris Gibson. The new husband and wife celebrated New Year's in Goa.
Kash says he'd love to hear from any of his 'old amigos' â you can email him at kashyap421@hotmail.com.

BOND, Maurice [MSc Applied Psychology and Counselling] is a Church of Scotland minister presently doing research in hermeneutics, multiculturalism and citizenship education with the faculty of education in Trinity Hall, Cambridge, where he also did his PGCE in 1978. Dr Bond remembers his supervisor Professor John McLeod, and says his dissertation in hermeneutics [the philosophy and psychology of understanding what it means to understand another person, culture or tradition] and counselling stands him in good stead now.

WAGNER, Josef [BSc Medical Biotechnology] had a momentous day on Friday 8th September when he finally submitted his PhD. Josef did his PhD studies at the University of Melbourne, Australia. His thesis investigated the potential of mouse stem cells and their possibility to differentiate into pituitary hormone cells.

Currently Josef is working at his first post-doc position, at the Murdoch Children's Research Institute where he did his PhD. The project he's involved in seeks to identify the agent which causes Crohn's disease.
Josef and his partner Renate have been enjoying life Down Under, and plan to move back to Europe at the end of 2007 or the beginning of 2008.

column1: SIM, Suwarni [BA Hons Business Administration] has been working for the past three years as the senior account manager in a finance company, where she also has some responsibility for marketing. Suwarni enjoys reading, travelling and meeting people from all over the world, and has volunteered to serve as Abertay's alumni contact for Indonesia.

column1: VON GRAEVENITZ, Sophie [BA Hons European Business Management w/Languages] has finally found a nice place to settle, and is about to start her second year of teaching at Kirkwall Grammar School on the Orkney Islands. Sophie writes that her labrador Frodo loves his new home in the Islands as well.

column1: AL-JANABI, Omar [HND Mechanical Engineering 1995] married former Abertay student Louise Kate Spence after completing his studies at Abertay. The couple reside with their children Adam and Aisha in Newcastle. Omar has since completed his MBA at Northumbria University and is currently working as a Business Development Manger at Newcastle University, which involves looking after commercial contracts. Omar says, "I am usually dotting about here and there visiting exciting and not so exciting places". He writes that he is still addicted to all that is mechanical and has a fondness for all things Italian. In his spare time he likes to ride his bike and work on his '71 Alfa.

BEAT, Iain F [BSc Hons Applicable Mathematics 1990] and his girlfriend Marie have continued their travels, visiting India, Malaysia, Thailand, Laos, Vietnam and Cambodia over the last 18 months. They both love the simplicity of life out there, and are delighted that it is also inexpensive.

To maintain a balance of work and leisure, Ian and Marie have decided to look into the possibility of teaching English, which is much sought after in Asia. The couple enrolled on a four-week intensive CELTA course in Chiang Mai, ad hope to teach in Thailand or China after they pass the course.
Says Ian, "It certainly beats being in our previous office jobs"!

CLARK, Michael D [BEng Hons Mechanical Engineering 1990, HND Engineering 1989] is busy working within the aerospace industry on the latest General Electric Aeroengine. Prior to that Michael worked on the competing Rolls-Royce Engine. He is due to start work in the oil industry soon, which he says will "enable him to stay at home for more than three days a week, and stretch his brain a bit, too"!

[NB: Michael is the son of Don Clark [HND Mechanical Engineering 1958], who was featured in the Spring/Summer 2006 edition of the magazine as the owner of the 1950s-vintage university scarf from the old Bell Street Tech.]

KINNEAR, Anne [BA Hons Accounting 1997] has been married to her husband Ross for ten years and is the mother of two little boys. For the past two years Anne has called New Jersey her home, although she has lived in the United States for six years.

LEVEY, Simon [BSc Chemistry with Business Studies 1992] married his Canadian sweetheart Lori in 2003, and is now the father of a little boy, Scott. He is employed as a research associate for the oil and petroleum industry.

MORRISON, Martin [BSc Hons Biotechnology 1995] met his wife Bronagh [neÃ© Toner, BA Hons Economics 1996] at Abertay. The couple did a lot of travelling after they graduated, getting married four years ago. Martin and Bronagh make their home in Northern Ireland, and recently had their first-born, a son named Caleb.
